content: Should drafts be sorted with most recent at the top, or be initially scrolled to the bottom, or something?
I seem to have ended up with like 25 drafts
I just deleted ten of them myself. If I were really wanting to find one of them (as opposed to sorting through a bunch of abandoned messages) I'd want the most recent visible right away.
I guess we already have an open issue to add displaying the timestamps
I think maybe start-scrolled-at-bottom is better than reversing the sort order, since that better fits the analogy of how we sort messages
Do people usually not use #3790 to reference PRs and issues? Should this be added to documentation (if it is not there already)?
I use #3790 when typing, but if I was on the page (as opposed to looking at an email or whatever), it's kinda easier to copy-paste the whole link than correctly retype the number
I guess one cool idea would be to dynamically add these special regexs to the "markdown help" popover
hm, I think I might be a fan of the most recent at top, but am happy to try both and see which we like.

FWIW we already have some inconsistency in our UI about most-recent. Only messages, to my knowledge, are shown most-recent-at-bottom. Topic lists and PM lists in the left sidebar are most-recent-at-top, and users in the right sidebar are vaguely most-recent-at-the-top. I don't know how I feel about the drafts issue, but I could see using most-recent-at-the-top, and I actually think there's some value in making our drafts page look/act different from the message pane.

but I wouldn't call the inconsistent yet. The fact new messages appear at the bottom leads to scrolling down. How weird would it feel if you had to scroll up or even if the messages were pushed down with every new message. Drafts most-recent-at-the-top makes most sense I think.
the message pane in the middle is like a scroll, not a stack.
I think this is also the first push containing the change to make "restore draft" re-narrow you to the narrow corresponding to the draft.
